Hi everyone i'm new to your team

Hi all! Has anyone found a workaround for the following scenario: 

• HubSpot integration with Salesforce. 
• Multiple audiences (like a marketplace, Etsy - buyer & seller, Uber - driver & homeowner) with records that can cross over between two or more audiences. 
• Records in Salesforce do not need to be unique on email address e.g <mailto:johndoe@gmail.com|johndoe@gmail.com> has two contact records in Salesforce - one as audience A and one as audience B. 
• The property data is different depending on the audience (address, phone, related objects, etc.). 
It’s a big one to unpack - but does anyone have any ideas / has seen this before and designed a solution? Sounds like a custom contact object / API could help….. :face_with_monocle:
is it possible to set a customer portal so a contact associated with multiple companies can see tickets for every company they are associated with?
OR is there a way to automatically associate a contact with a ticket based on what company is associated with the ticket or on a property value
Hi! Does somebody know if I can give access to the private apps sections to a no-super admin account?
Hi Jose, I have worked on a few private apps and it’s only the super admins who have access.
